info.title: Text Analytics Client
info.description: The Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics web services built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction and language detection. No training data is needed to use this API; just bring your text data. This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques to deliver best in class predictions. Further documentation can be found in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

post.description: The API returns a list of general named entities in a given document. For the list of supported entity types, check Supported Entity Types in Text Analytics API. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities returned for each valid document.

post.description: The API returns a list of entities with personal information (\"SSN\", \"Bank Account\" etc) in the document. For the list of supported entity types, check Supported Entity Types in Text Analytics API. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: (Optional) if set to 'PHI', response will contain only PHI entities.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of entities containing personal information returned for each valid document

post.summary: Linked entities from a well-known knowledge base
post.description: The API returns a list of recognized entities with links to a well-known knowledge base. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities with links to a well-known knowledge base returned for each valid document

post.description: The API returns a list of strings denoting the key phrases in the input text. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

200.description: A successful response results in 0 or more key phrases identified in each valid document

post.description: The API returns the detected language and a numeric score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

200.description: A successful call results in the detected language with the highest probability for each valid document

post.description: The API returns a detailed sentiment analysis for the input text. The analysis is done in multiple levels of granularity, start from the a document level, down to sentence and key terms (aspects) and opinions.

parameters.name: opinionMining
parameters.description: (Optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics including aspect-based sentiment analysis results.

200.description: A successful call results in a document sentiment prediction, as well as sentiment scores for each sentiment class (Positive, Negative, and Neutral)

post.summary: GenerateAnswer call to query knowledgebase (QnA Maker Managed).

source.description: Source from which Q-A was indexed. eg. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/QnAMaker/FAQs

questions.description: List of questions associated with the answer.

metadata.description: List of metadata associated with the answer.

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: Timestamp when the QnA was last updated.

isContextOnly.description:
To mark if a prompt is relevant only with a previous question or not.
true - Do not include this QnA as search result for queries without context
false - ignores context and includes this QnA in search result

prompts.description: List of prompts associated with the answer.

displayOrder.description: Index of the prompt - used in ordering of the prompts

qnaId.description: Qna id corresponding to the prompt - if QnaId is present, QnA object is ignored.

qna.description: QnA - Either QnaId or QnA needs to be present in a Prompt object

displayText.description: Text displayed to represent a follow up question prompt

QAErrorResponse.description: Error response. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

Error.description: The error object. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innerError.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

InnerErrorModel.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: A more specific error code than was provided by the containing error.

innerError.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Query.description: POST body schema to query the knowledgebase.

qnaId.description: Exact qnaId to fetch from the knowledgebase, this field takes priority over question.

question.description: User question to query against the knowledge base.

top.description: Max number of answers to be returned for the question.

context.description: Context object with previous QnA's information.

rankerType.description: Optional field. Set to 'QuestionOnly' for using a question only Ranker.

strictFilters.description: Find QnAs that are associated with the given list of metadata.

strictFiltersCompoundOperationType.description: Optional field. Set to 'OR' for using OR operation for strict filters.

answerSpanRequest.description: To configure Answer span prediction feature.

QContext.description: Context object with previous QnA's information.

previousQnaId.description: Previous QnA Id - qnaId of the top result.

answerSpan.description: Answer span object of QnA with respect to user's question.

userQuestion.description: The suggested question being provided as feedback.

qnaId.description: The qnaId for which the suggested question is provided as feedback.

AnswerSpanRequest.description: To configure Answer span prediction feature.

enable.description: Enable or Disable Answer Span prediction.

scoreThreshold.description: Minimum threshold score required to include an answer span.

topAnswersWithSpan.description: Number of Top answers to be considered for span prediction.

startIndex.description: Start index of answer span in answer.

endIndex.description: End index of answer span in answer.

documents.description: The set of documents to process as part of this batch.

MultiLanguageBatchInput.description: Contains a set of input documents to be analyzed by the service.

language.description: (Optional) This is the 2 letter ISO 639-1 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English; "es" for Spanish etc. If not set, use "en" for English as default.

MultiLanguageInput.description: Contains an input document to be analyzed by the service.

innererror.description: Inner error contains more specific information.

details.description: Details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

targetRef.description: A JSON pointer reference indicating the target object.

innererror.description: Inner error contains more specific information.

modelVersion.description: This field indicates which model is used for scoring.

sentiment.description: Predicted sentiment for document (Negative, Neutral, Positive, or Mixed).

confidenceScores.description: Document level sentiment confidence scores between 0 and 1 for each sentiment class.

documentsCount.description: Number of documents submitted in the request.

validDocumentsCount.description: Number of valid documents. This excludes empty, over-size limit or non-supported languages documents.

erroneousDocumentsCount.description: Number of invalid documents. This includes empty, over-size limit or non-supported languages documents.

transactionsCount.description: Number of transactions for the request.

RequestStatistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the request payload.

charactersCount.description: Number of text elements recognized in the document.

transactionsCount.description: Number of transactions for the document.

DocumentStatistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

SentimentConfidenceScorePerLabel.description: Represents the confidence scores between 0 and 1 across all sentiment classes: positive, neutral, negative.

sentiment.description: The predicted Sentiment for the sentence.

confidenceScores.description: The sentiment confidence score between 0 and 1 for the sentence for all classes.

offset.description: The sentence offset from the start of the document.

aspects.description: The array of aspect object for the sentence.

opinions.description: The array of opinion object for the sentence.

sentiment.description: Aspect level sentiment for the aspect in the sentence.

confidenceScores.description: Aspect level sentiment confidence scores for the aspect in the sentence.

offset.description: The aspect offset from the start of the sentence.

relations.description: The array of either opinion or aspect object which is related to the aspect.

sentiment.description: Opinion level sentiment for the aspect in the sentence.

confidenceScores.description: Opinion level sentiment confidence scores for the aspect in the sentence.

offset.description: The opinion offset from the start of the sentence.

isNegated.description: The indicator representing if the opinion is negated.

relationType.description: The type related to the aspect.

ref.description: The JSON pointer indicating the linked object.

AspectConfidenceScoreLabel.description: Represents the confidence scores across all sentiment classes: positive, neutral, negative.

modelVersion.description: This field indicates which model is used for scoring.
This field indicates which model is used for scoring.

statistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.
if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

text.description: Entity text as appears in the request.

category.description: Entity type, such as Person/Location/Org/SSN etc

subcategory.description: Entity sub type, such as Age/Year/TimeRange etc

offset.description: Start position for the entity text.

confidenceScore.description: Confidence score between 0 and 1 of the extracted entity.

modelVersion.description: This field indicates which model is used for scoring.

entities.description: Recognized well-known entities in the document.

statistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

matches.description: List of instances this entity appears in the text.

language.description: Language used in the data source.

id.description: Unique identifier of the recognized entity from the data source.

url.description: URL for the entity's page from the data source.

dataSource.description: Data source used to extract entity linking, such as Wiki/Bing etc.

bingId.description: Bing unique identifier of the recognized entity. Use in conjunction with the Bing Entity Search API to fetch additional relevant information.

confidenceScore.description: If a well-known item is recognized, a decimal number denoting the confidence level between 0 and 1 will be returned.

text.description: Entity text as appears in the request.

offset.description: Start position for the entity match text.

length.description: Length for the entity match text.

modelVersion.description: This field indicates which model is used for scoring.

keyPhrases.description: A list of representative words or phrases. The number of key phrases returned is proportional to the number of words in the input document.

statistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

modelVersion.description: This field indicates which model is used for scoring.

statistics.description: if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

name.description: Long name of a detected language (e.g. English, French).

iso6391Name.description: A two letter representation of the detected language according to the ISO 639-1 standard (e.g. en, fr).

confidenceScore.description: A confidence score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true.

Endpoint.name: Endpoint
Endpoint.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).

StringIndexType.name: stringIndexType
StringIndexType.description: (Optional) Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets.  Defaults to Text Elements (Graphemes) according to Unicode v8.0.0. For additional information see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets

values.description: Returned offset and length values will correspond to TextElements (Graphemes and Grapheme clusters) confirming to the Unicode 8.0.0 standard. Use this option if your application is written in .Net Framework or .Net Core and you will be using StringInfo.
Returned offset and length values will correspond to Unicode code points. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Python.
Returned offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Java, JavaScript.

ShowStats.name: showStats
ShowStats.description: (Optional) if set to true, response will contain request and document level statistics.

ModelVersion.name: model-version
ModelVersion.description: (Optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

LanguageInput.name: input
LanguageInput.description: Collection of documents to analyze for language endpoint.
